content.raw: A docstring or some sort of comment would be greatly appreciated in order to help understand the purpose of this class.
content.html: A docstring or some sort of comment would be greatly appreciated in order to help understand the purpose of this class.

content.raw: It looks like this would be better served with some sort of enumeration or constants. Presuambly these are states that cannot \(or should not overlap\)?
content.html: It looks like this would be better served with some sort of enumeration or constants. Presuambly these are states that cannot (or should not overlap)?

content.raw: If this is only used inside the “Runner” object, I’d consider putting this definition right _inside_ the Runner object itself and just call it `Steps`
content.html: If this is only used inside the “Runner” object, I’d consider putting this definition right inside the Runner object itself and just call it Steps

content.raw: If possible don't break \(\`\\\`\) before a paranthesis. You can put the starting paranthesis on the same line and avoid putting in a `\` completely.
content.html: If possible don't break (`\`) before a paranthesis. You can put the starting paranthesis on the same line and avoid putting in a \ completely.

content.raw: What is this class supposed to do if it does not get a `result_list`? Wouldn't everything else in this class be undefined?
content.html: What is this class supposed to do if it does not get a result_list? Wouldn't everything else in this class be undefined?

content.raw:
If this is only initialized based on training results, perhaps the class should be called “TrainResults”?

Is it possible to put `TRAIN_RESULT_TYPES` inside the class definition?
content.html:
If this is only initialized based on training results, perhaps the class should be called “TrainResults”?

Is it possible to put TRAIN_RESULT_TYPES inside the class definition?

content.raw: Why are options being moved from `namedtuple`s to \`OrderedDict\`s ?
content.html: Why are options being moved from namedtuples to `OrderedDict`s ?

content.raw: Why was the `SUPERVISION_SUPERVISED` added for this PR?
content.html: Why was the SUPERVISION_SUPERVISED added for this PR?

update.description:
* Removed all subdir creation from train\_run
* Train\_run loads options from train.tab
* Add function to load windows from bed file
* Import Window class from util
* Train has been split
* Added train steps test case
* Produce input.master for each train instance in init
* Save and reload the identify options
* Save train\_results files to their own directories
* revert function parse\_options back to pre steps code. Change was accidental
* Fixed saving bug in results file where it doubled the work dirname
* Used identify.tab to pass options between steps and prevent train.tab from overwriting
* Added identify steps test case
* Changed parse\_options to only allow the correct options to be applied to each of the steps and added train-run-round
* Broke parse\_options function
* Fixed fromoptions in cases where the options were not compatible with the step given
* Updated simpleidentifysteps test case for new command line changes
* Updated all test cases to match new command line order
* fixed touchstone for simpleconcat
* Revisions to step seperation code
* Remove resolution from identify
* Fix test cases for resolution changes
* Added train-run-round functionality to recover\_train\_instance
* some how got rid of tri file creation
* Updated train.tab files for new train options
* Checked for specific errno instead of just 2
* Changed dockerfile to hoffmanlab one in pipeline
* removed new line in \_util imports
* fixed configparser imports
* Python 3 revision performed in the wrong branch
* Fixed argument order in command line
* Fixed functionaliy of cmdline
* Fixed track\_indexes in task.py
* Updated test cases for different cmdline order
* Fixed docker image in pipeline
* added setup.py from default segway
* Fix run.sh for simpleidentifysteps
* Took task.py from default Segway branch
* Changed touchstone for train and identify steps for task.py changes
* Fixed layer issue caused by mistakenly removed rsplit
* Match online repo
* Fixed issue where Ordereddict wasn't being read in order
* Fixed job log headers
* used python to call compare directory in simple train steps
* used python to call compare directory in simple train steps
* Added run-round with multiple instances test
* fixed run.sh for indetify steps
update.title: Split Segway Tasks into Steps
